references.paper_title: Distributionally robust neural networks for group shifts: On the importance of regularization for worst-case generalization
references.reason: This paper introduces the concept of worst-group accuracy (WGA) and proposes techniques to improve it, which is a central theme in this paper.
This paper introduces the concept of spurious correlations in computer vision, which this paper revisits in the context of group robustness.
This paper introduces the AdamW optimizer, which is used in the experiments of this paper.

references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper introduces the ResNet architecture, which is used as a backbone in some of the experiments of this paper.

references.paper_title: BERT: pre-training of deep bidirectional transformers for language understanding
references.reason: This paper introduces the BERT architecture, which is used in some of the language-based experiments of this paper.
